Articles.Content:
Hello, first of all its a really nice game )) duh... 

Is there a complete starting guide for a complete newbie like myself? Mods, building rockets , mun landing , other planets landing missions...

Welcome.

The official release has changed almost everything in the game and I'm not aware of any guides that have been updated yet; apart from the in-game tutorials.

The Drawing Board (link in signature) is the best place to check what's available. General orbital mechanics, planetary transfers and similar space stuff are unaffected, except for recommendations about which parts/engines to use.

You may find my earlier (0.90) guides still useful, although don't expect the ships themselves to fly as advertised.

Installtion, configuration, settings and the game interface itself - [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111114-A-Complete-Beginner-s-Guide-Induction-To-Construction](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111114-A-Complete-Beginner-s-Guide-Induction-To-Construction)

Vehicle (mainly rocket) design from rover to spacestations - [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79658-Exploring-The-System-A-design-tutorial-campaign-0-90-Final](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79658-Exploring-The-System-A-design-tutorial-campaign-0-90-Final)

Guides are being written / filmed as we speak - best place to check is in the Tutorials section, at this point - just make sure you are searching for Kerbal Space Program 1.0, as many of the guides currently present were written for previous versions. As you probably guessed the release version is different enough, even from beta, that the many of the old guides are out of date.

Also, welcome! Check my sig for a guide and link to my channel, where I'm making a consolidated set of guides for all the major concepts.
And of course, don't forget to check out Scott Manley. Welcome aboard!
